attributes.action: Ensure restaurants serving Pakistani, Bangladeshi food cannot identify as Indian
attributes.additional_details: Restaurants serving Bangladeshi and Pakistani food are falsely claiming to be Indian restaurants, and in doing so are tarnishing the reputation of the Indian restaurant industry and Indian cuisine. A clear distinction must be made between restaurants of different cultures and different nations and this is a breach of trust for consumers, fraudulent misrepresentation of a business and an infringement on the many decades of goodwill developed by genuine Indian restaurants.
attributes.background: The Government must enforce marketing and trade laws to ensure that restaurants serving Pakistani, Bangladeshi cuisine are not fraudulently claiming to be Indian restaurants. This is a misrepresentation and fraudulent use of a national identity and profiteering using illegitimate trading names.

rejection.details: It is up to individual restaurateurs what to call their restaurants and how to describe their wares. This isn't a matter for the UK Government or House of Commons.
